meanings.definition: The quality or state of being flowery in appearance or fragrance.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with the sweet flowerinesses of roses and lilies.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate flowerinesses of the floral arrangements at the wedding.
meanings.sent3: The room was so full of flowerinesses that it felt like walking into a garden.
meanings.sent4: Her perfume carried a hint of flowerinesses that reminded him of a blooming meadow.
meanings.sent5: The air was heavy with the intoxicating flowerinesses of the blossoming cherry trees.

meanings.definition: Excessive use of flowery language or embellishment.
meanings.sent1: His writing was criticized for its unnecessary flowerinesses and lack of clarity.
meanings.sent2: The speech was filled with flowery language and unnecessary flowerinesses.
meanings.sent3: The advertisement was so full of flowerinesses that it sounded more like a poem than a product description.
meanings.sent4: Her compliments were always sincere, never tainted by any hint of flowerinesses.
meanings.sent5: The book was a refreshing change from the usual flowerinesses found in romantic novels.
